body: Just to add some more input, it works on my machine (macOS 10.12.6, build version 16G1036).
Not sure if it's related, but it was screaming fast prior to my update to 10.13.4. But since I upgraded yesterday performance has dropped like a rock.
I am not able to repro on current rust stable on macos 10.13.4.

This doesn't repro on rust stable for me either, so this looks like a new issue with nightly. Let me update my nightly and make sure it's still going on.

EDIT: That was the latest released nightly, so yeah.

rename.from: segfault on macOS on latest master
rename.to: segfault on macOS on latest master with rust nightly

body:
I'm seeing this issue as well, building from commit 1b7ffea with macOS 10.12.6 (16G1314) and rustc 1.27.0-nightly (ac3c2288f 2018-04-18):
<details>
<summary>Rust backtrace</summary>


</details>

Possibly a Rust bug? Doesn't look like our code is at fault.

The backtrace show that panic in src/locale.rs:26:9, which is: https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/1b7ffea136f55236729258ddbc6841282de91ae9/src/locale.rs#L26

Same as https://github.com/tomaka/winit/pull/428:

>Due to the recent changes in the Rust compiler, unconstrained type
variables are now deduced to `!` instead of `()`. There are some
occurrences where `msg_send!` is used without constraining its return
type (relying on the assumption that they would be deduced to be `()`).
As a result, the macOS port of winit stopped working in nightly.

So all `msg_send!` call should be set a return value expliclty, just like this:

`
let _ : () = msg_send![...];
`

Related RFC https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/35121
Seems like just `let () = msg_send![...];` should do the trick. I'm no mac user so I'd rather not write a PR for this, if any one is able to test, please feel free to send a PR. :)

I couldn't actually repro this on my machine, but can y'all check if this fixes the issue? https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/1280
